skill.name: python-executor
skill.description: Run Python code in a sandboxed inference.sh environment with common data, web, and media libraries.
skill.summary: Sandboxed Python execution with common data and media libraries.
skill.author: inference-sh

security_audit.summary: Documentation includes shell command examples for installing and running the CLI, including a pipe to shell installer. These are instructional and not executed by the skill itself, but they warrant caution. Network and crypto related flags appear to be documentation references without malicious intent.

medium_findings.title: Pipe to shell installer command in documentation
medium_findings.description: The quick start shows a curl command piped to sh for installing the CLI. This pattern is risky because it executes downloaded content without verification. It is documentation only and not executed by the skill.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: The command is explicitly visible and uses a pipe to sh, which is a known risky installer pattern.

low_findings.title: Shell command usage examples for the CLI
low_findings.description: The documentation includes multiple bash examples that invoke the infsh CLI. These commands are expected for a CLI driven skill and do not indicate hidden execution.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: The pattern is present, but it is documentation and not an automated execution path.

low_findings.title: Network request examples in documentation
low_findings.description: Examples show HTTP requests and external URLs for scraping and API calls. This is consistent with the stated use cases and does not show data exfiltration.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: The URLs are standard documentation references and examples, not hidden network behavior.

low_findings.title: False positive: weak cryptographic algorithm
low_findings.description: The flagged location is part of the description text and does not contain cryptographic code. No weak cryptography usage is present in the file.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: No cryptographic functions or algorithms appear near the flagged lines.

low_findings.title: False positive: network reconnaissance
low_findings.description: The flagged line is a note about safe execution and does not reference reconnaissance behavior. No recon logic is present in the documentation.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: The line is descriptive text without any scanning or enumeration behavior.

dangerous_patterns.title: Pipe to shell installation pattern
dangerous_patterns.description: The documentation shows a curl command piped to sh, which can execute unverified remote code.

content.user_title: Run Python tasks in a secure sandbox
content.value_statement: Running Python safely across data, web, and media tasks is difficult when environments differ. This skill runs code in a managed sandbox with common libraries and file outputs.
actual_capabilities: Execute Python 3.10 code through the infsh app runner.
Use preinstalled libraries for data analysis, scraping, and visualization.
Perform HTTP requests with common Python HTTP clients.
Write files to outputs/ and return them in responses.
Select the high_memory variant and configure execution timeout.
limitations: CPU only execution with no GPU acceleration or ML runtimes.
Non interactive execution that requires saving plots to files.
Execution time is limited to the configured timeout window.
Requires access to the inference.sh CLI to run the app.

use_cases.title: Analyze small datasets
use_cases.description: Create tables and charts and return files for review.

use_cases.title: Validate scraping logic
use_cases.description: Fetch a page and extract specific fields for a report.

use_cases.title: Generate demo assets
use_cases.description: Produce images or short clips for product demos.

prompt_templates.title: Run a simple check
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute Python to print the pandas version and return stdout only.

prompt_templates.title: Scrape a page title
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch https://example.com and return the page title as plain text.

prompt_templates.title: Create a chart file
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a small bar chart from sample data and save it to outputs/chart.png.

prompt_templates.title: Process a large dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the high_memory variant, read a CSV, summarize key metrics, and save outputs/summary.csv.

output_examples.input: User asks for a bar chart from a two column sales table.
output_examples.output: Returns a confirmation message and an image file named outputs/chart.png.

output_examples.input: User requests a quick scrape of a public page title.
output_examples.output: Responds with the extracted title and a short log of the request.

output_examples.input: User wants a CSV summary from a small dataset.
output_examples.output: Provides a summary line and a file named outputs/summary.csv.

best_practices: Describe inputs, outputs, and file names explicitly.
Write artifacts to outputs/ so they are returned automatically.
Keep network requests limited to trusted domains.
anti_patterns: Requesting interactive plots or GUI output.
Running jobs that exceed the timeout window.
Asking to install new system packages inside the sandbox.

faq.question: What Python version does the app use?
faq.answer: The app runs Python 3.10 in a sandboxed environment.

faq.question: Can it access the internet?
faq.answer: Yes, the examples show HTTP requests using Python libraries.

faq.question: How do I return files?
faq.answer: Save files to the outputs/ directory and they will be returned.

faq.question: Is there a high memory option?
faq.answer: Yes, use the high_memory variant for larger workloads.

faq.question: Can it run long interactive sessions?
faq.answer: No, execution is non interactive and limited by the timeout setting.

faq.question: Which libraries are available?
faq.answer: The documentation lists many preinstalled libraries for data, web, and media tasks.
